text:
For a printable copy of the recipe, go to
howtocookthat.net

Firstly, take three egg whites, 1/4 of a teaspoon
of cream of tartar, and whisk until you get
soft peaks.

Then put your sugar and your water into a
saucepan, and stir until the sugar is dissolved.

Then get a pastry brush, dip it in some water
and wash down the sides of the pan.

The reason why you do that is so that if you've
got any sugar splashed on the edges, it doesn't
burn before the sugar syrup itself is ready.

Then you will need a candy thermometer, you
put that on the side of your pan and you boil

the sugar syrup without stirring until it
reaches 238 degrees Fahrenheit.

As soon as it's reached that temperature you
need to take it off the heat, and pour it

in a thin stream in your egg whites, beating
with your electric mixers the whole time.

If you have a stand mixer that's ideal for
this recipe, because you then need to keep

beating it until it cools down to room temperature,
which can take some time.

If you've got hand mixers, like I do here
because my stand mixers broke, then to make

it quicker you can put the bowl in another
bowl with iced water underneath it, so that
it cools down quicker.

And then just continue beating your Italian
meringue until it's cooled down to room temperature.

You can then use this, it'll be nice and thick;
you can color it, you can then pour it onto

your cake, put it onto your cake, spread it
out with nice consistency.

Put it on thickly, because it tastes really
nice; it's not like buttercream, it's not
heavy, tastes more marshmallowy.

Put a thick layer on, and then use a palette
knife to make it nice and smooth.

Flat surface ready for your decorations to
go on.

This cake itself is is a chocolate cake, and
using three layers of chocolate cake with

chocolate mousse in-between and then the Italian
meringue over the top, and the Lego Ninjago
decorations on top after that.
